intro: Clidemia duidae, commonly known as the Hawaiian stinging nettle, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact. Clidemia duidae is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests.
